meanings.definition: To cover or repair with sod.
meanings.sent1: I will resod the bare patch in the yard with fresh grass.
meanings.sent2: The landscaper will resod the lawn to make it look green again.
meanings.sent3: After the storm, we had to resod the damaged area to restore the beauty of the garden.
meanings.sent4: The resodded lawn transformed the backyard into a lush paradise.
meanings.sent5: She resodded the front yard, turning it into a vibrant green carpet.

meanings.sent1: We need to resod the field before the game to ensure a smooth surface.
meanings.sent2: The gardener will resod the area where the grass didn't grow well.
meanings.sent3: The decision to resod the entire lawn surprised everyone at the neighborhood meeting.
meanings.sent4: The football team had to resod the field quickly after heavy rain destroyed the grass.
meanings.sent5: He resodded the backyard, making it perfect for outdoor gatherings.

meanings.sent1: The resod of the park was necessary to maintain its beauty.
meanings.sent2: Her job involves overseeing the resod of various landscapes.
meanings.sent3: The resod of the soccer field brought joy to the players.
meanings.sent4: The resod of the garden symbolized a fresh start for the homeowners.
meanings.sent5: The annual resod of the golf course keeps it looking pristine for players.
